summary: This is a service request ticket from Signet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions regarding a RAID system failure at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The ticket details technical support for a NICE Vision Pro Unit NVR with failed drives, initiated on August 8, 2019, and involves troubleshooting and attempted data recovery procedures.

persons.name: Jeff Cranor
persons.context: Assigned to work on the RAID system failure service request for the MCC New York location. Mentioned as the person who will be working on the issue.

persons.name: Jeff McKenzie
persons.context: Created the service request assignment and provided technical guidance. Corresponded with Qognify support regarding RAID rebuild documentation.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: Listed as assigned to the service request along with Jeff Cranor and Jeff McKenzie for the period of August 8-16, 2019.

persons.name: Derek Barr
persons.context: Provided technical support steps via email from Qognify to Jeff McKenzie regarding how to rebuild a RAID 5 array, including the password.

connections.description: Jeff McKenzie requested RAID rebuild documentation from Qognify support, and Derek Barr, a Senior Support Engineer, responded with technical steps.
Both are customer support technicians at Signet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions working on the same service request for the MCC New York RAID failure.
Both were assigned to work on the same service request for the MCC New York location from August 8-16, 2019.

events.title: RAID System Failure Reported
events.description: A service request is created after a private individual (likely MCC staff) reports a RAID system showing 2 bad drives on a NICE Vision Pro Unit NVR at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York.

events.title: Failed Drive Replacement Attempt
events.description: The private individual gains access to the DVR room and attempts to replace the failed RAID drives. The rebuild process fails, corrupting the video database because drives were removed without proper shutdown.

events.title: RAID Rebuild Documentation Request
events.description: Jeff McKenzie emails Qognify support requesting documentation for rebuilding a Pro Unit RAID array, indicating prior technical inquiries related to this equipment.

locations: 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E, Beltsville, MD 20705
keyFacts: The document is a service request for technical support on a RAID storage system located at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, 150 Park Row, dated August 8, 2019.
The system in question is a NICE Vision Pro Unit NVR, which is a video recording system, and the failure involved two bad drives in a RAID 5 array.
An attempted repair on August 10, 2019, by an unnamed individual (likely MCC staff) corrupted the video database because drives were removed without proper shutdown, potentially causing data loss.

The service request involves technicians from Signet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions (Jeff Cranor, Jeff McKenzie, Justin Houston) and references prior correspondence with Qognify support engineer Derek Barr.

The document is a routine IT support ticket and does not directly reference Jeffrey Epstein, crimes, or individuals involved in the Epstein case, but it concerns video recording equipment at a federal detention facility.
